item.title: Genshin Impact Leaks Dahlia's Model
item.description:
Summary

  • Dahlia is set to debut in Archon Quest before Version 5.7 playable release, with Hydro Sword user potential.
  • Fans offer high expectations for Dahlia as a male character, but temper expectations with his 4-Star status.
  • Version 5.7 focuses on Skirk, displaying low synergy with Dahlia, with potential future male characters like Varka.

A recent leak in the Genshin Impact community has revealed Dahlia's new model, who is set to debut in the current Archon Quest before becoming playable in Version 5.7. Dahlia was initially discovered by the community during the first wave of Fontaine leaks, but it took two years until he was officially unveiled by the developers in the Version 5.6 trailer. It's clear that Genshin Impact is preparing something special for Version 5.6, as the upcoming patch will take players back to Mondstadt to conclude a storyline that's been built up for years.

Albedo, Venti, and Dahlia seem to lie at the center of this storyline, with the latter presiding over Albedo's trial as one of its judges. From a narrative standpoint, Dahlia's role remains a mystery. As for his gameplay, players can expect Dahlia in Genshin Impact to be a 4-Star Hydro Sword user. There are many possible ways for his ability kit to go, and most notably, Hydro still lacks a proper Shield character, assuming Lan Yan's elemental absorption doesn't count. However, it won't be until the Version 5.7 beta that players will be able to see Dahlia in action.

That being said, his full model has already been revealed by Mero, implying that details of his ability kit aren't that far behind. Compared to his original model from 2023, the final design of Dahlia seems to have flipped his color scheme around. His coat is now white, while his trousers are black, and he wears a completely different pair of boots. Overall, the design implies a Genshin Impact character who is significantly less mischievous than his concept art, which is fitting for a judge and for the Deacon of the Knights of Favonius.

Genshin Impact: What Players Can Expect from Dahlia

It's clear that fans have been clamoring for more male characters in Genshin Impact during the Natlan era. Between Version 4.1 and Version 5.8, the developers will have added a grand total of one male 5-Star to the lineup. However, given that Dahlia will be a 4-Star character like Ifa and Ororon, Genshin Impact players should temper their expectations. While 4-Stars can be powerful in their own right, as seen with Xingqiu or Gaming, the chances of them having a subpar ability kit is significantly higher.

For all intents and purposes, HoYoverse is planning to make Skirk the star of Version 5.7, and according to recent leaks, she won't have much synergy with Dahlia. That being said, Nod Krai in Genshin Impact does promise plenty of male characters for people to enjoy, as names like Varka, Durin, Dottore, and even Capitano are tossed around as potentially playable 5-Stars. Players will get to find out more about Dahlia after the release of Version 5.6 on May 7, 2025.

Step into Teyvat, a vast world teeming with life and flowing with elemental energy.

You and your sibling arrived here from another world. Separated by an unknown god, stripped of your powers, and cast into a deep slumber, you now awake to a world very different from when you first arrived.

Thus begins your journey across Teyvat to seek answers from The Seven the gods of each element. Along the way, prepare to explore every inch of this wondrous world, join forces with a diverse range of characters, and unravel the countless mysteries that Teyvat holds...

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign's Most Important Post-Launch Addition is Already Clear
item.description:
Despite being a spin-off of Elden Ring , FromSoftware's next title, Elden Ring Nightreign , is not going to appeal to all fans of the original RPG. This upcoming action game is not a curated, single-player-focused experience like its predecessor was. Instead, it is more of a co-operative PvE title, somewhat similar in concept to Deep Rock Galactic or Helldivers 2 . Elden Ring Nightreign takes place in a procedurally-generated version of Elden Ring 's first open-world area, Limgrave, and it tasks players with defeating waves of bosses over three in-game days. Even though it can technically be played solo, the game is designed specifically for teams of three.

Although Elden Ring Nightreign is scheduled to come out later this month, the anticipation for the game seems to be a bit more muted than usual for a FromSoftware release. Considering how different Nightreign is from FromSoftware's typical games, this is not that surprising. That being said, there are a few reasons that may be deflating some people's interest in Elden Ring Nightreign . Perhaps the biggest of these reasons is the omission of a major feature in the game that fans have been consistently asking for: two-player co-op.

FromSoftware Should Add Two-Player Co-Op to Elden Ring Nightreign Shortly After Its Release

Elden Ring Nightreign Will Not Be Playable With Only Two Players, At Least at Launch

Even though Elden Ring Nightreign can be played with one or three players, it cannot be experienced in teams of two. FromSoftware revealed this unfortunate news back in December 2024, shortly after it announced Nightreign at The Game Awards 2024. In an interview with IGN, Elden Ring Nightreign director Junya Ishizaki confirmed that two-player co-op was not implemented into the game due to balancing issues rather than game design decisions. According to Ishizaki, three-player co-op was a "sweet spot" for Nightreign in FromSoftware's eyes, as it allowed the game to "not feel too overwhelming or too busy."

Despite FromSoftware's seemingly firm stance on the matter, it appears the company is reevaluating its decision not to implement two-player co-op in Elden Ring Nightreign . During a roundtable interview with the Philippine outlet UnGeek, Junya Ishizaki stated that FromSoftware was considering adding the highly-requested feature to the game. "Regarding having just two players, not three players or solo, it is something we are considering," Ishizaki said, "but it is currently not in the game at the moment." In other words, while two-player co-op won't be available in Nightreign at launch, it may be added in a later update.

FromSoft's Plans to Support Elden Ring Nightreign Post-Launch Spark Hope for Two-Player Co-Op

FromSoftware isn't planning to turn Elden Ring Nightreign into an endless live service game like Fortnite or Call of Duty: Warzone , but it does intend to support the game post-launch in some capacity. Although the company hasn't announced a content roadmap for Nightreign , it has shared a few details about what players can expect from the game in the months after its release. At the end of the new overview trailer for the game, FromSoftware confirmed that Elden Ring Nightreign will get paid DLC in the fourth quarter of 2025, which will include additional playable characters and bosses.

As great as it is that Elden Ring Nightreign is receiving a paid expansion later this year, it'd be even better if FromSoftware added two-player co-op to the game sometime in 2025, as well. Since Elden Ring fans who only have one friend to play with may not be able to experience this new game at launch, the three-player co-op restriction for Elden Ring Nightreign may limit its overall player count. If FromSoftware is able to make two-player co-op work in Elden Ring Nightreign without disrupting the game's balance and difficulty scaling, it would probably be in the company's best interest to implement it as soon as possible.

item.title: Rumor: Sony May Be Releasing an Unexpected PS5 Bundle
item.description:
Summary

  • Leak suggests two new PS5 bundles featuring Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 are on the way.
  • The bundles, one of which will be for the console's Digital Edition and the other for the Standard Edition, will both include a digital download code for Black Ops 6.
  • Call of Duty is now owned by Sony competitor Microsoft, making these bundles somewhat of a surprise.

A new leak suggests Sony is gearing up to release two new PlayStation 5 bundles featuring Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 . The two bundles, which will reportedly be available with the PlayStation 5 Slim and the PlayStation 5 Slim Digital Edition, come as a bit of a surprise, as Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is now over six months old and is owned by Sony competitor Microsoft.

After announcing its intent to acquire Call of Duty publisher Activision-Blizzard in 2022, Microsoft closed the nearly $69 billion deal in October 2023. Following Microsoft's acquisition of Activision-Blizzard, many of the publisher's IPs, such as Call of Duty , Spyro the Dragon , and Crash Bandicoot , have made their way to Xbox Game Pass. While both Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 and Modern Warfare 3 were added to the service after their release, Black Ops 6 made history by becoming the first Call of Duty title to launch on Xbox Game Pass on day one.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 PS5 Bundles Possibly Coming Soon

With the Call of Duty franchise now being owned by Activision's parent company, Microsoft, very few people would have expected Sony to continue releasing PlayStation 5 bundles featuring the shooter. However, according to Dealabs' Billbil-kun, who has accurately leaked details on numerous bundles, games, and accessories in the past, Sony is gearing up to launch two new PlayStation 5 bundles featuring Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 . The leaker states that one bundle will be for the PlayStation 5 Slim and will come with a digital download code for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 , while the second bundle will be exactly the same but will include the Digital Edition of the PlayStation 5 Slim.

A release date for the bundles is currently unknown, but the leaker speculates that they could be launched to coincide with the release of Call of Duty Season 4 or the new Days of Play event, both of which are rumored to be arriving later this month. As for the price, the bundle featuring the disc version of the console will reportedly be priced at $449.99 USD / 499.99, while the digital bundle will be priced at approximately $399.99 USD / 449.99.

With Sony yet to officially announce the Black Ops 6 PS5 bundle, it's unknown if the aforementioned prices are correct. But, should they be accurate, this would be a great price point for fans to pick up the console, especially for those within Europe. Last month, Sony revealed it would be increasing the price of the PlayStation 5 in some regions. The increase has seen a hike of 50 for the Digital Edition, raising the price from 449.99 to 499.99.

Although Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's inclusion in a new bundle is somewhat surprising, it isn't the first title to receive a PlayStation 5 bundle months after its launch. Back in March, Sony revealed a new PS5 bundle featuring Astro Bot, a critically acclaimed 3D platformer exclusive to the PlayStation 5 . The new PlayStation mascot has joined other PlayStation console exclusives, such as God of War Ragnarok , Horizon Forbidden West , and Marvel's Spider-Man 2 , to receive their own bundles.

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 - Most Overpowered Lumina Combinations That Can Break The Game
item.description:
Summary

  • Limited party size in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33; only 5 members, 3 in battle, 2 reserves.
  • Building a strong party involves considering party types and utilizing key Lumina allotments.
  • Lumina like Burn Build, Death Build, and Healing/Tint Build can enhance strategy and gameplay.

For a turn-based RPG, the party is relatively small in this game. Players will essentially have five party members to work with for most of the game beyond a certain point in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 which does contain some spoilers for those interested. In battle, players can form a party of three and if those three characters die, the two reserves will pop in to finish the fight but they cannot be swapped manually unlike Final Fantasy 10 as an example.

So, there are a lot of factors to consider when forming the best party in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 with so few members. That's why party types will be considered, including defensive or offensive types. A good Picto allotment, which can unlock Lumina to equip, is one of the best ways to make a strong party even better. Also, it goes without saying, but once Painted Power gets unlocked, which can break the damage limit of 9,999 HP, that should be equipped to every Lumina build. So, let's go through all of the ways Lumina builds can help break the game.

5 Burn Build

Burn Baby Burn

  • Beneficial Contamination: +2 AP On Applying Status Effect
  • Breaking Burn: 25% Break Damage On Burned Enemies
  • Burn Affinity: 25% More Damage On Burned Enemies
  • Burning Break: 3 Burn Stacks On Broken Enemy
  • Double Burn: Extra Burn Stack
  • Weakness Gain: +1AP On Exploring Weakness

Most fire-based skills in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 will apply a status effect called Burn. Burn will damage enemies on every turn, and the more stacks they have of Burn, the more damage they will take. Thats what this build tries to take advantage of as Burn, even to enemies not weak to it or resistant to it, can take a lot of heavy damage.

All of these Lumina will help either apply more stacks of Burn or maybe even have characters do more damage to enemies infected with Burn. Not every character can benefit from a Burn-based build in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, but among the party, Maelle stands out as most of her attacks are fire-base,d and she has a lot of strong weapons with fire elementals.

4 Death Build

Give Enemies Hell When You Die

  • Burning Death: Apply Burn To Enemy Party In Death
  • Energising Revive: +3 AP To Allies When Revived
  • Healing Death: Party Recovers Full Health In Death
  • Powerful Shell: Get Powerful When Gaining Shell
  • Protecting Death: Party Gets Shell In Death
  • Revive Paradox: Play Immediately After Revival
  • Second Chance: Revive Once Per Battle
  • Shielding Death: Party Gets 3 Shields In Death

Even in death, players can get a one-up on enemies, which could help win the battle overall. To continue the Burn status effect talk for Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , Burning Death will infect the enemy party with stacks of Burn. Healing Death is great because it will give the non-fallen party members full HP. For the party, Protecting Death will give them Shell if someone falls and Shielding Death will give them Shields.

Powerful Shell is not death or revive-related, but when a character gets Shell, they will also gain Powerful to raise attack power. Best of all is Second Chanc,e which will revive a character once per battle and with Energising Revive stacked on, the party can gain AP. Revive Paradox will enhance Second Chance too because that revived character can act right away.

3 General Build

Get The Most From Your Party

  • Attack Lifestyle: Base Attack Recovers 15% HP
  • Augmented Attack: Base Attack Does 50% More Damage
  • Augmented Counter 1: Parries Do 25% More Damage
  • Cheater: Act Twice
  • Combo Attack: Base Attack Hits Twice
  • Energising Attack 1: +1 AP On Base Attack
  • Energising Turn: +1 AP On Turn Start
  • Recovery: Recover 10% HP On Turn Start
  • Second Chance: Revive Once Per Battle
  • Warming Up: Gain 5% More Damage On Every Turn (Maxed At 5)

This is a general allotment of Lumina that can make any party good to go for general battles or boss battles in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 . Attack Lifestyle, Augmented Attack, and Combo Attack will make normal attacks better. Augmented Counter 1 will do more damage with Parries, and other versions can stack with it.

Energising Attack 1 and Energising Turn will help the party get more AP from their turns, and Warming Up will increase attack power on turn starts for a few rounds. Attack Lifestyle and Recovery are both good for healing HP, along with the aforementioned Second Chance. Cheater is the best Lumina among the pack, though, because characters can act twice in a row and still get full turn benefits.

2 Healing/Tint Build

Keep The Party Alive

  • Attack Lifestyle: Base Attack Recovers 15% HP
  • Charging Tint: Gradient Attack Charges 5% On Using Item
  • Cleansing Tint: Healing Tints Remove Status Effects Too
  • Effective Heal: All Heals Are Doubled
  • Empowering Tint: Healing Tints Apply Powerful
  • Energising Heal: +2 AP When Healing An Ally
  • Healing Share: Recover 15% HP From Ally Heals
  • Healing Tint Energy: +1 AP On Using A Healing Tint
  • Protecting Tint: Healing Tints Apply Shell
  • Recovery: Recover 10% HP On Turn Start
  • Shared Care: Recover 50% Of The HP You Give To An Ally
  • Second Chance: Revive Once Per Battle

For those worried about healing overall in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , there are a few Lumina to build around beyond Attack Lifestyle, Recovery, and Second Chance. For example, Empowering Tint and Healing Tint Energy can help recover AP when using items. Empowering Tint and Protecting Tint will give characters stat boosts like Powerful and Shell when using items.

Healing Share and Shared Care can make the party essentially get healed whenever someone else gets healed. Cleansing Tint will remove a status effect by using items, which is a nice benefit. Finally, Charging Tint will make items recover the Gradient Attack meter, and Gradient Attacks in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 are like Limit Breaks in Final Fantasy games. The more players can use them, the better.

1 Risky Build

Die Or Win Quickly

  • Confident: Take 50% Less Damage But Cant Be Healed
  • Glass Canon: Give 25% More Damage, Take 25% More Damage
  • Immaculate: 30% More Damage Until Hit
  • Inverted Affinity: Inverted For 3 Turns, 50% More Damage During This State
  • Roulette: 50% Chance To Deal Half Or 200% Damage

This final combination of Luminas is for players who like to take risks in their RPGs. Also, if they have mastered the art of using Dodge or Parry in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 . Confident will make a character take less damage, but they cant be healed, not counting revivals. Glass Canon can make that Lumina riskier by decreasing defense in exchange for attack power, which is how glass canon archetypes typically work in games.

Immaculate will increase damage too, but only if players can avoid being hit. Inverted is a bad status effect as healing energy will damage the party, but Inverted Affinity combined with Confident wont make healing matter anyway. Finally, Roulette is a weird one as players can have a chance at attacks either doing half or extreme amounts of damage. Overall, while players can take more damage, they can dish it out too, which should make battles end quicker.

item.title: Zelda: Tears of the Kingdoms Most Unsung Ancient Power May Have Life Left In It
item.description:
In The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom , players have an arsenal of abilities that they can use to traverse the game's large open world. Among the abilities that can be unlocked in Tears of the Kingdom , there is one that stands out, not due to its popularity, but because of its utility. The existence of this ability opens up interesting opportunities for the franchise moving forward, and Nintendo should strongly consider taking advantage of them.

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom is primarily known for its Ultrahand and Fuse abilities, which give players the freedom to build a near-endless array of devices. While these abilities may hog the spotlight, they are not the only ones that can be put to good use. Ascend lets Link fly up and phase through nearly any surface, and it is certainly useful in many situations. This underappreciated ability makes the game even more enjoyable, and it would be a shame if Ascend did not return in a future entry in the franchise.

Why the Ascend Ability Should Return in Future Zelda Games

If future Zelda games were to take anything from previous entries in the series, Tears of the Kingdom 's Ascend ability is one that should be considered. As for what the power could do in future titles, there are a few opportunities that Ascend could provide:

  • It would allow for the creation of new and interesting enemies, which could be designed to be addressed with the Ascend ability.
  • Ascend would make it possible for future Zelda games to expand on Tears of the Kingdom 's verticality, taking level designs to greater heights and resulting in more beautiful environments that aren't just limited to the ground.
  • The ability could inform future entries' platforming, and sections could be created that cannot be overcome simply by jumping from one end to another and would instead require the type of creative thinking that players enjoy.

Given all that, it's clear the Ascend ability could contribute to future Zelda titles being fun and memorable. Hopefully, Nintendo will consider the idea of reusing the ability, as it could be to the benefit of the series and its fans.

How Future Zelda Games Could Bring Back Tears of the Kingdoms Ascend Ability

It is unlikely that the next Zelda game will be a direct sequel to Tears of the Kingdom , which could make it difficult to explain the return of the Ascend ability. However, there are ways that it could be done. For one, a character in a future game could create a device that provides the same functionality as the ability, and perhaps there could even be a line or two of dialogue that pays homage to Ascend. Another option would be to introduce a race that survives through the use of an ability similar to Ascend, and Link must try to learn it, justifying the ability's return. Approaches like these could give the ability life beyond Tears of the Kingdom , allowing it to reach its full potential.

The Switch 2 edition of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom will give players another opportunity to appreciate the Ascend ability's functionality, and perhaps that will increase its chances of appearing in future titles. If fans realize just how useful the ability can be, and are vocal about wanting it back in future entries, then Nintendo may just give the ancient power a chance to return. The developer could also iterate upon Ascend, giving it even more utility, and perhaps it could even become more popular than the more well-known Ultrahand and Fuse abilities as a result.
